result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas Peter Aguirre

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- $500 bond on file.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FOUR times per day including 6:00 a.m. and 10:00 p.m. daily. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Court orders that as long as Defendant has no missed or positive tests through JSC, Defendant may be removed from testing on 9/8/22. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive effective 9/8/22.

- Take medications as prescribed

- No possession of firearms

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, R.P. L. and E.M.N. or their residence. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- May return to residence for one time only to obtain belongings in the presence of law enforcement

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping

9:36 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas Peter Aguirre in court.  Attorney T. Gregory Amann in court for Lucas Peter Aguirre. Pam of VW appeared. Includes 22CF277, 22TR1158, 22TR1159, 22TR1181, 22TR1172, 22TR1173, 22TR1174, 22TR1175, 22TR1179, and 22TR1180. Court reviews files. Atty Amann argues bond modification and requests to remove testing. Negative hair folical test. ADA Damrau responds and states hair folical didn't include alcohol testing. ADA Damrau objects to modification. Court may consider removing sooner if information regarding treatment is provided. Atty Amann states victim's petition for bond modification filed. Court will not address at this time. Atty Amann doesn't anticipate any motions other than motions in limine. Atty Amann isn't requesting speedy trial. Court sets STC via Zoom to allow time for potential resolution. Court orders that as long as Defendant has no missed or positive tests through JSC, Defendant may be removed from testing on 9/8/22.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:30 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas Peter Aguirre in court.  Attorney T. Gregory Amann in court for Lucas Peter Aguirre. Karn of Victim Witness appeared with Victim. Tina of JSC appeared. Court reviews file. Atty Amann states DE had a negative test. Court orders Defendant to complete hair folical test in Woodville by 5 PM today (7/20/22). ADA Becker argument regarding testing. Court orders SCRAM testing. Adjourned at 9:38 AM.  gll
to Modify Bond. Filed by ADA Brekken. km        to rg

9:34 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas Peter Aguirre appeared by video.  Attorney T. Gregory Amann in court for Lucas Peter Aguirre. Victim R.L. appeared with Pam of VW. Includes 22CF277, 22TR1158, 22TR1159, 22TR1181, 22TR1172, 22TR1173, 22TR1174, 22TR1175, 22TR1179, and 22TR1180. Court reviews files. ADA Brekken states all discovery has been sent to Atty Amann. Atty Amann hasn't gotten through all discovery, but doesn't know that he will have any motions. Atty Amann hasn't been able to review discovery with Defendant, as Defendant has been recovering from injuries sustained. Atty Amann requests 30 more days. ADA Brekken states victim is requesting speedy disposition. Victim makes statements. ADA Brekken states case will be reassigned to new ADA. Court sets further STC via Zoom to allow more time for Atty Amann to review discovery for potential motions. DE confirms address and phone number. ADA Brekken states DE was taken to the hospital after incident, which is why testing was not requested at INIT. ADA Brekken requests DE test tomorrow, as well as regular SCRAM testing. Atty Amann responds and states he hasn't been able to talk to DE regarding this. Court orders Defendant to test at JSC today. Off record at 9:49 AM. Recalled at 9:52 AM. Atty Amann states DE will get hear by 4PM today and would like the allegations invegistated by the Sheriff. Court orders Defendant to test at JSC today (7/14/22) by 4PM. Court sets BBH to address potential testing at JSC, as well as a hair follicle test. Adjourned at 9:54 AM.  gll
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

INCLUDES 22CF277 ARGN, 22TR1158, 22TR1159, 22TR1172, 22TR1173, 22TR1174, 22TR1175, 22TR1179, 22TR1180, and 22TR1181 (STC). 22CF277 ARGN: Atty Amann waives further reading. Enter NG Plea on all counts. Waives Speedy Trial. Court sets STC. Court enters NG on TR. Court confirms address and phone number. INCLUDES 22CF277(PH), 22TR1159, 22TR1158, 22TR1180, 22TR1181, 22TR1179, 22TR1175, 22TR1174, 22TR1173 and 22TR1172. Atty. Amann states DE is prepared to waive preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing. Court sets ARGN. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned: 2:37 PM. kma  Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Includes 22CF277, 22TR1158, 22TR1159, 22TR1181, 22TR1172, 22TR1173, 22TR1174, 22TR1175, 22TR1179, 22TR1180. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE has hired private atty.  Bond already set. Atty Amann waives prelim time limits. Court sets PH. 22TR1158, 22TR1159, 22TR1181, 22TR1172, 22TR1173, 22TR1174, 22TR1175, 22TR1179, 22TR1180. Enter NG on all counts. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF277, 22TR1159, 22TR1158, 22TR1180, 22TR1181, 22TR1179, 22TR1175, 22TR1174, 22TR1173 & 22TR1172 (INIT):
  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken. Lucas Peter Aguirre pro se via zoom. Case called at 1:49 p.m. Court notes receiving a letter from Atty Amann whom is just assisting DE. Not retained at this time. DE is currently in Regions Hospital and was given zoom information. Court notes a complaint was filed. DE states he is working on hiring Atty Amann. Does not know when he will be released from bond.  ADA Brekken would like to address bond today. Requesting the original complaint be sealed. Court will send bond to hospital and bond to be posted on Monday. Court will seal complaints and bond. If released from hospital, must appear in person. If not, may appear via zoom. Court will not enter pleas at this time.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
